intro: Chailletia vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis chailletia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Viti Levu in Fiji. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
